permit_costs.notes: Plus county fees; additional fees apply

requirements.minimum_road_width: Road width must accommodate load width + 2 ft clearance on each side
requirements.pilot_car_escort: 1 escort required for loads >12' wide OR >100' long; 2 escorts for >16' wide; certified escort required for superloads
requirements.trip_permits: Required for all OS/OW movements; available online through TxDMV system
requirements.fuel_permits: Not required - fuel tax already collected
requirements.running_hours: 30 minutes before sunrise to 30 minutes after sunset; no weekend/holiday travel for superloads
requirements.holiday_restrictions: No travel on major holidays for superloads; regular permits may travel
requirements.banner_regulations: "OVERSIZE LOAD" banner required front and/or rear; 18" letters, black on yellow, fluorescent material
requirements.flag_regulations: 18" square red or orange flags required at each corner for loads >4' wider than vehicle
requirements.warning_light_regulations: Amber rotating/flashing lights required on escort vehicles and load when >12' wide
requirements.permit_dimensions: Max without superload: 125'L x 20'W x 18'H; Superload: case-by-case
requirements.commodity_specific: Agricultural equipment exempt from certain restrictions; wind energy components require special routing
requirements.route_requirements: Pre-approved routes for superloads; bridge analysis required; utility notification for high loads

requirements.minimum_road_width: Road width must be at least 2 ft wider than load on each side
requirements.pilot_car_escort: 1 escort for >12' wide; 2 escorts for >14' wide OR >120' long; OK certified escort drivers required
requirements.trip_permits: Available online or by phone; 24-hour processing
requirements.fuel_permits: IFTA credentials required for interstate carriers
requirements.running_hours: Daylight hours only for loads >12' wide; 1/2 hour before sunrise to 1/2 hour after sunset
requirements.holiday_restrictions: No travel on New Year's Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, Christmas
requirements.banner_regulations: "OVERSIZE LOAD" sign required; 12" letters minimum, black on yellow
requirements.flag_regulations: Red or orange flags 12" minimum at extremities for loads extending >4' from vehicle
requirements.warning_light_regulations: Amber flashing lights required on escort vehicles; load must have clearance lights
requirements.permit_dimensions: Standard max: 110'L x 16'W x 15'H; Superload permits available for larger
requirements.commodity_specific: Farm equipment exempt from width restrictions on state highways during planting/harvest
requirements.route_requirements: Designated truck routes in metro areas; some roads restricted to certain times

permit_costs.notes: Varies by size, weight, and route

requirements.minimum_road_width: Minimum 24 ft roadway for loads up to 14' wide
requirements.height_pole: Required for all loads over 14' high
requirements.pilot_car_escort: 1 front escort for >14' wide; 2 escorts for >16' wide; rear escort required for loads >150' long
requirements.trip_permits: Online system available; permits issued same day if applied before noon
requirements.fuel_permits: IFTA or KS fuel permit required
requirements.running_hours: 1/2 hour before sunrise to 1/2 hour after sunset for >12' wide
requirements.holiday_restrictions: No travel on 6 major holidays; weekend restrictions for >16' wide in certain areas
requirements.banner_regulations: "OVERSIZE LOAD" banner required on front and rear for loads >12' wide; 18" letters
requirements.flag_regulations: 18" square red or orange flags at corners for projecting loads
requirements.warning_light_regulations: Amber rotating lights on escorts; load must have amber flashing lights when >14' wide
requirements.permit_dimensions: Standard: 110'L x 16'W x 14.5'H; Superload permits available
requirements.commodity_specific: Special provisions for agricultural equipment up to 18' wide on non-interstate roads
requirements.route_requirements: Must use designated truck routes in cities; bridge restrictions on some county roads

permit_costs.notes: Additional fees for heavy loads and bridge crossings

requirements.minimum_road_width: Road width must be adequate for safe passage with 1 ft clearance each side
requirements.pilot_car_escort: 1 escort for >12' wide; 2 escorts for >14' wide or >120' long; MO certified escorts
requirements.trip_permits: Available online through MoDOT system; 24-hour approval for standard permits
requirements.fuel_permits: IFTA or Missouri fuel tax permit required
requirements.running_hours: Daylight only for loads >12' wide; no travel during peak hours (7-9 AM, 4-6 PM) in metro areas
requirements.holiday_restrictions: No travel on 7 major holidays; restricted hours on holiday weekends
requirements.banner_regulations: "OVERSIZE LOAD" sign required front and rear; minimum 12" letters, black on yellow reflective
requirements.flag_regulations: Red or orange flags 16" square at extremities when load extends >4' beyond vehicle
requirements.warning_light_regulations: Amber flashing lights on escorts and load when >12' wide; must be visible 500 ft
requirements.permit_dimensions: Standard: 110'L x 16'W x 14'H; Superloads require special engineering review
requirements.commodity_specific: Agricultural implements up to 20' wide allowed on state highways with restrictions
requirements.route_requirements: Advance notice required for superloads; bridge analysis for loads >150,000 lbs; metro area restrictions

permit_costs.notes: Seasonal weight restrictions apply; reduced fees during non-frost period

requirements.minimum_road_width: Minimum 20 ft traveled way for 12' wide loads
requirements.pilot_car_escort: 1 escort for >12' wide or >100' long; 2 escorts for >16' wide; Iowa DOT certified
requirements.trip_permits: Online permit system available; instant approval for standard dimensions
requirements.running_hours: Sunrise to sunset for >12' wide; no travel 1/2 hour before sunset to 1/2 hour after sunrise
requirements.holiday_restrictions: No travel on 8 major holidays; no weekend travel for superloads
requirements.banner_regulations: "OVERSIZE LOAD" banner front and rear; 18" letters minimum, black on yellow fluorescent
requirements.flag_regulations: 18" square red or orange fluorescent flags at extremities
requirements.warning_light_regulations: Amber rotating beacons on escorts; flashing amber lights on load when >14' wide
requirements.permit_dimensions: Standard: 100'L x 16'W x 13.5'H; Reduced during seasonal restrictions
requirements.annual_permit_cost: $300 annual permit; additional fees for seasonal periods
requirements.commodity_specific: Farm equipment permitted up to 18' wide on primary roads during planting/harvest seasons
requirements.route_requirements: Seasonal weight restrictions (spring thaw March-May); load posting maps available online

permit_costs.notes: I-35 designated as super-load corridor with premium permits

requirements.minimum_road_width: Minimum roadway width must be load width plus 3 ft on each side
requirements.height_pole: Required for all loads exceeding 13'6" height
requirements.pilot_car_escort: 1 certified escort for >12' wide; 2 escorts for >15' wide or >110' long; MN DOT certification required
requirements.trip_permits: Online permitting available; expedited processing for I-35 corridor; 48-hour advance notice for superloads
requirements.fuel_permits: IFTA credentials required; Minnesota fuel tax permit for intrastate
requirements.running_hours: Daylight hours only for >12' wide; 1 hour after sunrise to 1 hour before sunset; severe weather restrictions
requirements.holiday_restrictions: No travel on 10 major holidays; no Friday travel for superloads; weekend restrictions November-March
requirements.banner_regulations: "OVERSIZE LOAD" signs required front and rear; 18" letters minimum, black on fluorescent yellow-green
requirements.flag_regulations: 18" square red or orange fluorescent flags at all extremities exceeding vehicle body
requirements.warning_light_regulations: Amber rotating or flashing lights on escorts and load; must be visible 500 ft; additional lights required for >16' wide
requirements.permit_dimensions: Standard: 100'L x 18'W x 13.5'H; I-35 Super-load corridor allows larger with special permit
requirements.annual_permit_cost: $500 standard annual; $1,000+ for super-load corridor designation
requirements.commodity_specific: Special permits for wind energy components; agricultural equipment allowed up to 20' wide on non-interstate roads during growing season
requirements.route_requirements: I-35 designated as Twin Trailer network and super-load corridor; advance routing required; bridge analysis mandatory for >200,000 lbs; severe winter weight restrictions (9-ton axle limit during spring thaw)
